    Submodule.norm_coe
    Submodule.normedAddCommGroup

    Normed (semi)groups #

    In this file we define 10 classes:

    • Norm, NNNorm: auxiliary classes endowing a type α with a function norm : α → ℝ (notation: ‖x‖) and nnnorm : α → ℝ≥0 (notation: ‖x‖₊), respectively;
    • Seminormed...Group: A seminormed (additive) (commutative) group is an (additive) (commutative) group with a norm and a compatible pseudometric space structure: ∀ x y, dist x y = ‖x / y‖ or ∀ x y, dist x y = ‖x - y‖, depending on the group operation.
    • Normed...Group: A normed (additive) (commutative) group is an (additive) (commutative) group with a norm and a compatible metric space structure.

    We also prove basic properties of (semi)normed groups and provide some instances.

    Notes #

    The current convention dist x y = ‖x - y‖ means that the distance is invariant under right addition, but actions in mathlib are usually from the left. This means we might want to change it to dist x y = ‖-x + y‖.

    The normed group hierarchy would lend itself well to a mixin design (that is, having SeminormedGroup and SeminormedAddGroup not extend Group and AddGroup), but we choose not to for performance concerns.

    Tags #

    normed group

    source
    class Norm (E : Type u_1) :
    Type u_1

    • the ℝ-valued norm function.

      norm : E → ℝ

    Auxiliary class, endowing a type E with a function norm : E → ℝ with notation ‖x‖. This class is designed to be extended in more interesting classes specifying the properties of the norm.

    Instances
      source
      class NNNorm (E : Type u_1) :
      Type u_1

      • the ℝ≥0-valued norm function.

        nnnorm : E → NNReal

      Auxiliary class, endowing a type α with a function nnnorm : α → ℝ≥0 with notation ‖x‖₊.

      Instances

            source
            class SeminormedAddGroup (E : Type u_1) extends Norm , AddGroup , PseudoMetricSpace :
            Type u_1

            • The distance function is induced by the norm.

              dist_eq : autoParam (∀ (x y : E), dist x y = ‖x - y‖) _auto✝

            A seminormed group is an additive group endowed with a norm for which dist x y = ‖x - y‖ defines a pseudometric space structure.

            Instances
              source
              class SeminormedGroup (E : Type u_1) extends Norm , Group , PseudoMetricSpace :
              Type u_1

                            def NormedAddGroup.ofSeparation {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] (h : ∀ (x : E), ‖x‖ = 0 → x = 0) :
                            NormedAddGroup E

                            Construct a NormedAddGroup from a SeminormedAddGroup satisfying ∀ x, ‖x‖ = 0 → x = 0. This avoids having to go back to the (Pseudo)MetricSpace level when declaring a NormedAddGroup instance as a special case of a more general SeminormedAddGroup instance.

                            Equations
                            • NormedAddGroup.ofSeparation h = let src := inst; NormedAddGroup.mk

                                      dist x y = ‖x - y‖
                                      Equations

                                                                                          def AddGroupSeminorm.toSeminormedAddGroup.proof_8 {E : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup E] (f : AddGroupSeminorm E) (x : E) (y : E) :
                                                                                          dist x y = dist x y
                                                                                          Equations
                                                                                          • (_ : dist x y = dist x y) = (_ : dist x y = dist x y)
                                                                                          Instances For
                                                                                            source
                                                                                            def AddGroupSeminorm.toSeminormedAddGroup {E : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup E] (f : AddGroupSeminorm E) :
                                                                                            SeminormedAddGroup E

                                                                                            Construct a seminormed group from a seminorm, i.e., registering the pseudodistance and the pseudometric space structure from the seminorm properties. Note that in most cases this instance creates bad definitional equalities (e.g., it does not take into account a possibly existing UniformSpace instance on E).

                                                                                            Equations
                                                                                            • AddGroupSeminorm.toSeminormedAddGroup f = SeminormedAddGroup.mk
                                                                                            Instances For
                                                                                              source
                                                                                              def AddGroupSeminorm.toSeminormedAddGroup.proof_7 {E : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup E] (f : AddGroupSeminorm E) :
                                                                                              (Bornology.cobounded E).sets = (Bornology.cobounded E).sets
                                                                                              Equations

                                                                                                        def GroupSeminorm.toSeminormedGroup {E : Type u_1} [inst : Group E] (f : GroupSeminorm E) :
                                                                                                        SeminormedGroup E

                                                                                                        Construct a seminormed group from a seminorm, i.e., registering the pseudodistance and the pseudometric space structure from the seminorm properties. Note that in most cases this instance creates bad definitional equalities (e.g., it does not take into account a possibly existing UniformSpace instance on E).

                                                                                                                                  abbrev Metric.Bounded.exists_pos_norm_le.match_1 {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] {s : Set E} (motive : (∃ C, ∀ (x : E), x ∈ s → ‖x‖ ≤ C) → Prop) :
                                                                                                                                  (x : ∃ C, ∀ (x : E), x ∈ s → ‖x‖ ≤ C) → ((R₀ : ℝ) → (hR₀ : ∀ (x : E), x ∈ s → ‖x‖ ≤ R₀) → motive (_ : ∃ C, ∀ (x : E), x ∈ s → ‖x‖ ≤ C)) → motive x
                                                                                                                                  Equations
                                                                                                                                  • Metric.Bounded.exists_pos_norm_le.match_1 motive x h_1 = Exists.casesOn x fun w h => h_1 w h

                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                    def normAddGroupSeminorm (E : Type u_1) [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] :
                                                                                                                                    AddGroupSeminorm E

                                                                                                                                    The norm of a seminormed group as an additive group seminorm.

                                                                                                                                    Equations
                                                                                                                                    • normAddGroupSeminorm E = { toFun := norm, map_zero' := (_ : ‖0‖ = 0), add_le' := (_ : ∀ (a b : E), ‖a + b‖ ≤ ‖a‖ + ‖b‖), neg' := (_ : ∀ (a : E), ‖-a‖ = ‖a‖) }
                                                                                                                                    Instances For
                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                      def normGroupSeminorm (E : Type u_1) [inst : SeminormedGroup E] :
                                                                                                                                      GroupSeminorm E

                                                                                                                                      The norm of a seminormed group as a group seminorm.

                                                                                                                                      Equations
                                                                                                                                      • normGroupSeminorm E = { toFun := norm, map_one' := (_ : ‖1‖ = 0), mul_le' := (_ : ∀ (a b : E), ‖a * b‖ ≤ ‖a‖ + ‖b‖), inv' := (_ : ∀ (a : E), ‖a⁻¹‖ = ‖a‖) }
                                                                                                                                      Instances For

                                                                                                                                        theorem AddMonoidHomClass.lipschitz_of_bound {𝓕 : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] [inst : AddMonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) (C : ℝ) (h : ∀ (x : E), ‖↑f x‖ ≤ C * ‖x‖) :
                                                                                                                                        LipschitzWith (Real.toNNReal C) ↑f

                                                                                                                                        A homomorphism f of seminormed groups is Lipschitz, if there exists a constant C such that for all x, one has ‖f x‖ ≤ C * ‖x‖. The analogous condition for a linear map of (semi)normed spaces is in Mathlib/Analysis/NormedSpace/OperatorNorm.lean.

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem MonoidHomClass.lipschitz_of_bound {𝓕 : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] [inst : MonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) (C : ℝ) (h : ∀ (x : E), ‖↑f x‖ ≤ C * ‖x‖) :
                                                                                                                                        LipschitzWith (Real.toNNReal C) ↑f

                                                                                                                                        A homomorphism f of seminormed groups is Lipschitz, if there exists a constant C such that for all x, one has ‖f x‖ ≤ C * ‖x‖. The analogous condition for a linear map of (semi)normed spaces is in Mathlib/Analysis/NormedSpace/OperatorNorm.lean.

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem lipschitzOnWith_iff_norm_sub_le {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] {s : Set E} {f : E → F} {C : NNReal} :
                                                                                                                                        LipschitzOnWith C f s ↔ ∀ ⦃x : E⦄, x ∈ s → ∀ ⦃y : E⦄, y ∈ s → ‖f x - f y‖ ≤ ↑C * ‖x - y‖
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem lipschitzOnWith_iff_norm_div_le {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] {s : Set E} {f : E → F} {C : NNReal} :
                                                                                                                                        LipschitzOnWith C f s ↔ ∀ ⦃x : E⦄, x ∈ s → ∀ ⦃y : E⦄, y ∈ s → ‖f x / f y‖ ≤ ↑C * ‖x / y‖
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem LipschitzOnWith.norm_div_le {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] {s : Set E} {f : E → F} {C : NNReal} :
                                                                                                                                        LipschitzOnWith C f s → ∀ ⦃x : E⦄, x ∈ s → ∀ ⦃y : E⦄, y ∈ s → ‖f x / f y‖ ≤ ↑C * ‖x / y‖

                                                                                                                                        Alias of the forward direction of lipschitzOnWith_iff_norm_div_le.

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem LipschitzOnWith.norm_sub_le {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] {s : Set E} {f : E → F} {C : NNReal} :
                                                                                                                                        LipschitzOnWith C f s → ∀ ⦃x : E⦄, x ∈ s → ∀ ⦃y : E⦄, y ∈ s → ‖f x - f y‖ ≤ ↑C * ‖x - y‖
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem LipschitzOnWith.norm_sub_le_of_le {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] {s : Set E} {a : E} {b : E} {r : ℝ} {f : E → F} {C : NNReal} (h : LipschitzOnWith C f s) (ha : a ∈ s) (hb : b ∈ s) (hr : ‖a - b‖ ≤ r) :
                                                                                                                                        ‖f a - f b‖ ≤ ↑C * r
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem LipschitzOnWith.norm_div_le_of_le {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] {s : Set E} {a : E} {b : E} {r : ℝ} {f : E → F} {C : NNReal} (h : LipschitzOnWith C f s) (ha : a ∈ s) (hb : b ∈ s) (hr : ‖a / b‖ ≤ r) :
                                                                                                                                        ‖f a / f b‖ ≤ ↑C * r

                                                                                                                                        theorem AddMonoidHomClass.continuous_of_bound {𝓕 : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] [inst : AddMonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) (C : ℝ) (h : ∀ (x : E), ‖↑f x‖ ≤ C * ‖x‖) :
                                                                                                                                        Continuous ↑f

                                                                                                                                        A homomorphism f of seminormed groups is continuous, if there exists a constant C such that for all x, one has ‖f x‖ ≤ C * ‖x‖

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem MonoidHomClass.continuous_of_bound {𝓕 : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] [inst : MonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) (C : ℝ) (h : ∀ (x : E), ‖↑f x‖ ≤ C * ‖x‖) :
                                                                                                                                        Continuous ↑f

                                                                                                                                        A homomorphism f of seminormed groups is continuous, if there exists a constant C such that for all x, one has ‖f x‖ ≤ C * ‖x‖.

                                                                                                                                        instance SeminormedAddGroup.toNNNorm {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] :
                                                                                                                                        NNNorm E
                                                                                                                                        Equations
                                                                                                                                        • SeminormedAddGroup.toNNNorm = { nnnorm := fun a => { val := ‖a‖, property := (_ : 0 ≤ ‖a‖) } }
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        instance SeminormedGroup.toNNNorm {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] :
                                                                                                                                        NNNorm E
                                                                                                                                        Equations
                                                                                                                                        • SeminormedGroup.toNNNorm = { nnnorm := fun a => { val := ‖a‖, property := (_ : 0 ≤ ‖a‖) } }

                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto f a (nhds b) ↔ Filter.Tendsto (fun e => ‖f e - b‖) a (nhds 0)
                                                                                                                                        source

                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto f a (nhds b) ↔ Filter.Tendsto (fun e => ‖f e / b‖) a (nhds 0)
                                                                                                                                        source

                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto f a (nhds 1) ↔ Filter.Tendsto (fun e => ‖f e‖) a (nhds 0)

                                                                                                                                        theorem comap_norm_nhds_zero {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.comap norm (nhds 0) = nhds 0
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem comap_norm_nhds_one {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.comap norm (nhds 0) = nhds 1
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem squeeze_zero_norm' {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] {f : α → E} {a : α → ℝ} {t₀ : Filter α} (h : ∀ᶠ (n : α) in t₀, ‖f n‖ ≤ a n) (h' : Filter.Tendsto a t₀ (nhds 0)) :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto f t₀ (nhds 0)

                                                                                                                                        Special case of the sandwich theorem: if the norm of f is eventually bounded by a real function a which tends to 0, then f tends to 1. In this pair of lemmas (squeeze_zero_norm' and squeeze_zero_norm), following a convention of similar lemmas in Topology.MetricSpace.Basic and Topology.Algebra.Order, the ' version is phrased using "eventually" and the non-' version is phrased absolutely.

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem squeeze_one_norm' {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] {f : α → E} {a : α → ℝ} {t₀ : Filter α} (h : ∀ᶠ (n : α) in t₀, ‖f n‖ ≤ a n) (h' : Filter.Tendsto a t₀ (nhds 0)) :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto f t₀ (nhds 1)

                                                                                                                                        Special case of the sandwich theorem: if the norm of f is eventually bounded by a real function a which tends to 0, then f tends to 1. In this pair of lemmas (squeeze_one_norm' and squeeze_one_norm), following a convention of similar lemmas in Topology.MetricSpace.Basic and Topology.Algebra.Order, the ' version is phrased using "eventually" and the non-' version is phrased absolutely.

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem squeeze_zero_norm {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] {f : α → E} {a : α → ℝ} {t₀ : Filter α} (h : ∀ (n : α), ‖f n‖ ≤ a n) :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto a t₀ (nhds 0) → Filter.Tendsto f t₀ (nhds 0)

                                                                                                                                        Special case of the sandwich theorem: if the norm of f is bounded by a real function a which tends to 0, then f tends to 0.

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem squeeze_one_norm {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] {f : α → E} {a : α → ℝ} {t₀ : Filter α} (h : ∀ (n : α), ‖f n‖ ≤ a n) :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto a t₀ (nhds 0) → Filter.Tendsto f t₀ (nhds 1)

                                                                                                                                        Special case of the sandwich theorem: if the norm of f is bounded by a real function a which tends to 0, then f tends to 1.

                                                                                                                                        source

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem Filter.Tendsto.op_zero_isBoundedUnder_le' {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} {G : Type u_4} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup G] {f : α → E} {g : α → F} {l : Filter α} (hf : Filter.Tendsto f l (nhds 0)) (hg : Filter.IsBoundedUnder (fun x x_1 => x ≤ x_1) l (norm ∘ g)) (op : E → F → G) (h_op : ∃ A, ∀ (x : E) (y : F), ‖op x y‖ ≤ A * ‖x‖ * ‖y‖) :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto (fun x => op (f x) (g x)) l (nhds 0)

                                                                                                                                        A helper lemma used to prove that the (scalar or usual) product of a function that tends to zero and a bounded function tends to zero. This lemma is formulated for any binary operation op : E → F → G with an estimate ‖op x y‖ ≤ A * ‖x‖ * ‖y‖ for some constant A instead of multiplication so that it can be applied to (*), flip (*), (•), and flip (•).

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem Filter.Tendsto.op_one_isBoundedUnder_le' {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} {G : Type u_4} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] [inst : SeminormedGroup G] {f : α → E} {g : α → F} {l : Filter α} (hf : Filter.Tendsto f l (nhds 1)) (hg : Filter.IsBoundedUnder (fun x x_1 => x ≤ x_1) l (norm ∘ g)) (op : E → F → G) (h_op : ∃ A, ∀ (x : E) (y : F), ‖op x y‖ ≤ A * ‖x‖ * ‖y‖) :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto (fun x => op (f x) (g x)) l (nhds 1)

                                                                                                                                        A helper lemma used to prove that the (scalar or usual) product of a function that tends to one and a bounded function tends to one. This lemma is formulated for any binary operation op : E → F → G with an estimate ‖op x y‖ ≤ A * ‖x‖ * ‖y‖ for some constant A instead of multiplication so that it can be applied to (*), flip (*), (•), and flip (•).

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem Filter.Tendsto.op_zero_isBoundedUnder_le {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} {G : Type u_4} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup G] {f : α → E} {g : α → F} {l : Filter α} (hf : Filter.Tendsto f l (nhds 0)) (hg : Filter.IsBoundedUnder (fun x x_1 => x ≤ x_1) l (norm ∘ g)) (op : E → F → G) (h_op : ∀ (x : E) (y : F), ‖op x y‖ ≤ ‖x‖ * ‖y‖) :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto (fun x => op (f x) (g x)) l (nhds 0)

                                                                                                                                        A helper lemma used to prove that the (scalar or usual) product of a function that tends to zero and a bounded function tends to zero. This lemma is formulated for any binary operation op : E → F → G with an estimate ‖op x y‖ ≤ ‖x‖ * ‖y‖ instead of multiplication so that it can be applied to (*), flip (*), (•), and flip (•).

                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem Filter.Tendsto.op_one_isBoundedUnder_le {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} {G : Type u_4} [inst : SeminormedGroup E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] [inst : SeminormedGroup G] {f : α → E} {g : α → F} {l : Filter α} (hf : Filter.Tendsto f l (nhds 1)) (hg : Filter.IsBoundedUnder (fun x x_1 => x ≤ x_1) l (norm ∘ g)) (op : E → F → G) (h_op : ∀ (x : E) (y : F), ‖op x y‖ ≤ ‖x‖ * ‖y‖) :
                                                                                                                                        Filter.Tendsto (fun x => op (f x) (g x)) l (nhds 1)

                                                                                                                                        A helper lemma used to prove that the (scalar or usual) product of a function that tends to one and a bounded function tends to one. This lemma is formulated for any binary operation op : E → F → G with an estimate ‖op x y‖ ≤ ‖x‖ * ‖y‖ instead of multiplication so that it can be applied to (*), flip (*), (•), and flip (•).

                                                                                                                                        def SeminormedAddGroup.induced {𝓕 : Type u_1} (E : Type u_2) (F : Type u_3) [inst : AddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] [inst : AddMonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) :
                                                                                                                                        SeminormedAddGroup E

                                                                                                                                        A group homomorphism from an AddGroup to a SeminormedAddGroup induces a SeminormedAddGroup structure on the domain.

                                                                                                                                        Equations
                                                                                                                                        • SeminormedAddGroup.induced E F f = let src := PseudoMetricSpace.induced (↑f) SeminormedAddGroup.toPseudoMetricSpace; SeminormedAddGroup.mk
                                                                                                                                        Instances For
                                                                                                                                          source
                                                                                                                                          def SeminormedAddGroup.induced.proof_1 {𝓕 : Type u_3} (E : Type u_1) (F : Type u_2) [inst : AddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] [inst : AddMonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) (x : E) (y : E) :
                                                                                                                                          dist x y = ‖x - y‖
                                                                                                                                          Equations
                                                                                                                                          • (_ : dist x y = ‖x - y‖) = (_ : dist x y = ‖x - y‖)
                                                                                                                                          Instances For
                                                                                                                                            source
                                                                                                                                            def SeminormedGroup.induced {𝓕 : Type u_1} (E : Type u_2) (F : Type u_3) [inst : Group E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] [inst : MonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) :
                                                                                                                                            SeminormedGroup E

                                                                                                                                            A group homomorphism from a Group to a SeminormedGroup induces a SeminormedGroup structure on the domain.

                                                                                                                                            Equations
                                                                                                                                            • SeminormedGroup.induced E F f = let src := PseudoMetricSpace.induced (↑f) SeminormedGroup.toPseudoMetricSpace; SeminormedGroup.mk
                                                                                                                                            Instances For
                                                                                                                                              source
                                                                                                                                              def SeminormedAddCommGroup.induced {𝓕 : Type u_1} (E : Type u_2) (F : Type u_3) [inst : AddCommGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] [inst : AddMonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) :
                                                                                                                                              SeminormedAddCommGroup E

                                                                                                                                              A group homomorphism from an AddCommGroup to a SeminormedAddGroup induces a SeminormedAddCommGroup structure on the domain.

                                                                                                                                              Equations
                                                                                                                                              • SeminormedAddCommGroup.induced E F f = let src := SeminormedAddGroup.induced E F f; SeminormedAddCommGroup.mk
                                                                                                                                              Instances For
                                                                                                                                                source
                                                                                                                                                def SeminormedAddCommGroup.induced.proof_1 (E : Type u_1) [inst : AddCommGroup E] (a : E) (b : E) :
                                                                                                                                                a + b = b + a
                                                                                                                                                Equations
                                                                                                                                                • (_ : ∀ (a b : E), a + b = b + a) = (_ : ∀ (a b : E), a + b = b + a)
                                                                                                                                                Instances For
                                                                                                                                                  source
                                                                                                                                                  def SeminormedCommGroup.induced {𝓕 : Type u_1} (E : Type u_2) (F : Type u_3) [inst : CommGroup E] [inst : SeminormedGroup F] [inst : MonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) :
                                                                                                                                                  SeminormedCommGroup E

                                                                                                                                                  A group homomorphism from a CommGroup to a SeminormedGroup induces a SeminormedCommGroup structure on the domain.

                                                                                                                                                  Equations
                                                                                                                                                  • SeminormedCommGroup.induced E F f = let src := SeminormedGroup.induced E F f; SeminormedCommGroup.mk
                                                                                                                                                  Instances For
                                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                                    def NormedAddGroup.induced.proof_1 {𝓕 : Type u_3} (E : Type u_1) (F : Type u_2) [inst : AddGroup E] [inst : NormedAddGroup F] [inst : AddMonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) (h : Function.Injective ↑f) :
                                                                                                                                                    ∀ {x y : E}, dist x y = 0 → x = y
                                                                                                                                                    Equations
                                                                                                                                                    • (_ : dist x y = 0 → x = y) = (_ : dist x y = 0 → x = y)
                                                                                                                                                    Instances For
                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                      def NormedAddGroup.induced {𝓕 : Type u_1} (E : Type u_2) (F : Type u_3) [inst : AddGroup E] [inst : NormedAddGroup F] [inst : AddMonoidHomClass 𝓕 E F] (f : 𝓕) (h : Function.Injective ↑f) :
                                                                                                                                                      NormedAddGroup E

                                                                                                                                                      An injective group homomorphism from an AddGroup to a NormedAddGroup induces a NormedAddGroup structure on the domain.

                                                                                                                                                      Equations
                                                                                                                                                      • NormedAddGroup.induced E F f h = let src := SeminormedAddGroup.induced E F f; let src_1 := MetricSpace.induced (↑f) h NormedAddGroup.toMetricSpace; NormedAddGroup.mk

                                                                                                                                                        NormedGroup E

                                                                                                                                                            ∀ {x y : E}, dist x y = 0 → x = y
                                                                                                                                                            Equations

                                                                                                                                                              def NormedAddCommGroup.induced.proof_1 (E : Type u_1) [inst : AddCommGroup E] (a : E) (b : E) :
                                                                                                                                                              a + b = b + a
                                                                                                                                                              Equations
                                                                                                                                                              • (_ : ∀ (a b : E), a + b = b + a) = (_ : ∀ (a b : E), a + b = b + a)

                                                                                                                                                                    a +ᵥ Metric.closedBall b r = Metric.closedBall (a +ᵥ b) r
                                                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                                                    theorem smul_closedBall'' {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedCommGroup E] {a : E} {b : E} {r : ℝ} :
                                                                                                                                                                    a • Metric.closedBall b r = Metric.closedBall (a • b) r
                                                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                                                    theorem vadd_ball'' {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] {a : E} {b : E} {r : ℝ} :
                                                                                                                                                                    a +ᵥ Metric.ball b r = Metric.ball (a +ᵥ b) r
                                                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                                                    theorem smul_ball'' {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedCommGroup E] {a : E} {b : E} {r : ℝ} :
                                                                                                                                                                    a • Metric.ball b r = Metric.ball (a • b) r
                                                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                                                    theorem controlled_sum_of_mem_closure {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] {a : E} {s : AddSubgroup E} (hg : a ∈ closure ↑s) {b : ℕ → ℝ} (b_pos : ∀ (n : ℕ), 0 < b n) :
                                                                                                                                                                    ∃ v, Filter.Tendsto (fun n => Finset.sum (Finset.range (n + 1)) fun i => v i) Filter.atTop (nhds a) ∧ (∀ (n : ℕ), v n ∈ s) ∧ ‖v 0 - a‖ < b 0 ∧ ∀ (n : ℕ), 0 < n → ‖v n‖ < b n
                                                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                                                    theorem controlled_prod_of_mem_closure {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedCommGroup E] {a : E} {s : Subgroup E} (hg : a ∈ closure ↑s) {b : ℕ → ℝ} (b_pos : ∀ (n : ℕ), 0 < b n) :
                                                                                                                                                                    ∃ v, Filter.Tendsto (fun n => Finset.prod (Finset.range (n + 1)) fun i => v i) Filter.atTop (nhds a) ∧ (∀ (n : ℕ), v n ∈ s) ∧ ‖v 0 / a‖ < b 0 ∧ ∀ (n : ℕ), 0 < n → ‖v n‖ < b n
                                                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                                                    theorem controlled_sum_of_mem_closure_range {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup F] {j : E →+ F} {b : F} (hb : b ∈ closure ↑(AddMonoidHom.range j)) {f : ℕ → ℝ} (b_pos : ∀ (n : ℕ), 0 < f n) :
                                                                                                                                                                    ∃ a, Filter.Tendsto (fun n => Finset.sum (Finset.range (n + 1)) fun i => ↑j (a i)) Filter.atTop (nhds b) ∧ ‖↑j (a 0) - b‖ < f 0 ∧ ∀ (n : ℕ), 0 < n → ‖↑j (a n)‖ < f n
                                                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                                                    theorem controlled_prod_of_mem_closure_range {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedCommGroup E] [inst : SeminormedCommGroup F] {j : E →* F} {b : F} (hb : b ∈ closure ↑(MonoidHom.range j)) {f : ℕ → ℝ} (b_pos : ∀ (n : ℕ), 0 < f n) :
                                                                                                                                                                    ∃ a, Filter.Tendsto (fun n => Finset.prod (Finset.range (n + 1)) fun i => ↑j (a i)) Filter.atTop (nhds b) ∧ ‖↑j (a 0) / b‖ < f 0 ∧ ∀ (n : ℕ), 0 < n → ‖↑j (a n)‖ < f n
                                                                                                                                                                    source

                                                                                                                                                                      instance SeminormedAddCommGroup.to_uniformAddGroup {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] :
                                                                                                                                                                      UniformAddGroup E

                                                                                                                                                                      A seminormed group is a uniform additive group, i.e., addition and subtraction are uniformly continuous.

                                                                                                                                                                      • (_ : UniformAddGroup E) = (_ : UniformAddGroup E)

                                                                                                                                                                          ‖a‖ ≤ 0 ↔ a = 0

                                                                                                                                                                          AddGroupSeminorm.toFun (normAddGroupSeminorm E) 0 = 0

                                                                                                                                                                          • (_ : AddGroupSeminorm.toFun (normAddGroupSeminorm E) 0 = 0) = (_ : AddGroupSeminorm.toFun (normAddGroupSeminorm E) 0 = 0)

                                                                                                                                                                                      Some relations with HasCompactSupport

                                                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                                                      theorem hasCompactSupport_norm_iff {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} [inst : NormedAddGroup E] [inst : TopologicalSpace α] {f : α → E} :
                                                                                                                                                                                      (HasCompactSupport fun x => ‖f x‖) ↔ HasCompactSupport f
                                                                                                                                                                                      source

                                                                                                                                                                                      HasCompactSupport f → HasCompactSupport fun x => ‖f x‖

                                                                                                                                                                                      Alias of the reverse direction of hasCompactSupport_norm_iff.

                                                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                                                      theorem Continuous.bounded_above_of_compact_support {α : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} [inst : NormedAddGroup E] [inst : TopologicalSpace α] {f : α → E} (hf : Continuous f) (h : HasCompactSupport f) :
                                                                                                                                                                                      ∃ C, ∀ (x : α), ‖f x‖ ≤ C
                                                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                                                      theorem HasCompactSupport.exists_pos_le_norm {α : Type u_2} {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddGroup α] {f : α → E} [inst : Zero E] (hf : HasCompactSupport f) :
                                                                                                                                                                                      ∃ R, 0 < R ∧ ∀ (x : α), R ≤ ‖x‖ → f x = 0
                                                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                                                      theorem HasCompactMulSupport.exists_pos_le_norm {α : Type u_2} {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddGroup α] {f : α → E} [inst : One E] (hf : HasCompactMulSupport f) :
                                                                                                                                                                                      ∃ R, 0 < R ∧ ∀ (x : α), R ≤ ‖x‖ → f x = 1

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Binary product of normed groups #

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Norm (E × F)
                                                                                                                                                                                                      Equations
                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Prod.toNorm = { norm := fun x => ‖x.fst‖ ⊔ ‖x.snd‖ }
                                                                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                                                                      theorem Prod.norm_def {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : Norm E] [inst : Norm F] (x : E × F) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                      ‖x‖ = max ‖x.fst‖ ‖x.snd‖
                                                                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                                                                      theorem norm_fst_le {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : Norm E] [inst : Norm F] (x : E × F) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                      ‖x.fst‖ ≤ ‖x‖
                                                                                                                                                                                                      source

                                                                                                                                                                                                      ‖x.snd‖ ≤ ‖x‖
                                                                                                                                                                                                      source

                                                                                                                                                                                                      ‖x‖ ≤ r ↔ ‖x.fst‖ ≤ r ∧ ‖x.snd‖ ≤ r
                                                                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                                                                      def Prod.seminormedAddGroup.proof_1 {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} [inst : SeminormedAddGroup E] [inst : SeminormedAddGroup F] (x : E × F) (y : E × F) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                      max (dist x.fst y.fst) (dist x.snd y.snd) = max ‖x.fst - y.fst‖ ‖x.snd - y.snd‖
                                                                                                                                                                                                      Equations
                                                                                                                                                                                                      • (_ : max (dist x.fst y.fst) (dist x.snd y.snd) = max ‖x.fst - y.fst‖ ‖x.snd - y.snd‖) = (_ : max (dist x.fst y.fst) (dist x.snd y.snd) = max ‖x.fst - y.fst‖ ‖x.snd - y.snd‖)
                                                                                                                                                                                                      Instances For

                                                                                                                                                                                                        dist x y = ‖x - y‖
                                                                                                                                                                                                        Equations
                                                                                                                                                                                                        • (_ : ∀ (x y : E × F), dist x y = ‖x - y‖) = (_ : ∀ (x y : E × F), dist x y = ‖x - y‖)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Finite product of normed groups #

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                                                                                                      def Pi.seminormedAddGroup.proof_1 {ι : Type u_1} {π : ι → Type u_2} [inst : Fintype ι] [inst : (i : ι) → SeminormedAddGroup (π i)] (x : (i : ι) → π i) (y : (i : ι) → π i) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                      ↑(Finset.sup Finset.univ fun b => nndist (x b) (y b)) = ↑(Finset.sup Finset.univ fun b => ‖(((i : ι) → π i) - ((i : ι) → π i)) ((i : ι) → π i) instHSub x y b‖₊)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ‖x‖ ≤ r ↔ ∀ (i : ι), ‖x i‖ ≤ r

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ‖f i‖ ≤ ‖f‖
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        theorem norm_le_pi_norm' {ι : Type u_2} {π : ι → Type u_1} [inst : Fintype ι] [inst : (i : ι) → SeminormedGroup (π i)] (f : (i : ι) → π i) (i : ι) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ‖f i‖ ≤ ‖f‖
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        source

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ‖f i‖₊ ≤ ‖f‖₊

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ‖f i‖₊ ≤ ‖f‖₊

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ‖fun _i => a‖₊ = ‖a‖₊
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        theorem Pi.sum_norm_apply_le_norm {ι : Type u_1} {π : ι → Type u_2} [inst : Fintype ι] [inst : (i : ι) → SeminormedAddGroup (π i)] (f : (i : ι) → π i) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        (Finset.sum Finset.univ fun i => ‖f i‖) ≤ Fintype.card ι • ‖f‖

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The $L^1$ norm is less than the $L^\infty$ norm scaled by the cardinality.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        theorem Pi.sum_norm_apply_le_norm' {ι : Type u_1} {π : ι → Type u_2} [inst : Fintype ι] [inst : (i : ι) → SeminormedGroup (π i)] (f : (i : ι) → π i) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        (Finset.sum Finset.univ fun i => ‖f i‖) ≤ Fintype.card ι • ‖f‖

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The $L^1$ norm is less than the $L^\infty$ norm scaled by the cardinality.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        theorem Pi.sum_nnnorm_apply_le_nnnorm {ι : Type u_1} {π : ι → Type u_2} [inst : Fintype ι] [inst : (i : ι) → SeminormedAddGroup (π i)] (f : (i : ι) → π i) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        (Finset.sum Finset.univ fun i => ‖f i‖₊) ≤ Fintype.card ι • ‖f‖₊

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The $L^1$ norm is less than the $L^\infty$ norm scaled by the cardinality.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        theorem Pi.sum_nnnorm_apply_le_nnnorm' {ι : Type u_1} {π : ι → Type u_2} [inst : Fintype ι] [inst : (i : ι) → SeminormedGroup (π i)] (f : (i : ι) → π i) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        (Finset.sum Finset.univ fun i => ‖f i‖₊) ≤ Fintype.card ι • ‖f‖₊

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The $L^1$ norm is less than the $L^\infty$ norm scaled by the cardinality.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        def Pi.seminormedAddCommGroup.proof_1 {ι : Type u_1} {π : ι → Type u_2} [inst : (i : ι) → SeminormedAddCommGroup (π i)] (a : (i : ι) → π i) (b : (i : ι) → π i) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        a + b = b + a
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Equations
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • (_ : ∀ (a b : (i : ι) → π i), a + b = b + a) = (_ : ∀ (a b : (i : ι) → π i), a + b = b + a)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Instances For
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          source
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          def Pi.seminormedAddCommGroup.proof_2 {ι : Type u_1} {π : ι → Type u_2} [inst : Fintype ι] [inst : (i : ι) → SeminormedAddCommGroup (π i)] (x : (i : ι) → π i) (y : (i : ι) → π i) :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          dist x y = ‖x - y‖
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Equations
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • (_ : ∀ (x y : (i : ι) → π i), dist x y = ‖x - y‖) = (_ : ∀ (x y : (i : ι) → π i), dist x y = ‖x - y‖)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Instances For

                                                                                                                                                                                                                            SeminormedAddCommGroup ((i : ι) → π i)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                            def Pi.normedAddGroup.proof_1 {ι : Type u_1} {π : ι → Type u_2} [inst : Fintype ι] [inst : (i : ι) → NormedAddGroup (π i)] :
                                                                                                                                                                                                                            ∀ {x y : (i : ι) → π i}, dist x y = 0 → x = y
                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Equations
                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • (_ : dist x y = 0 → x = y) = (_ : dist x y = 0 → x = y)
